1.title: Shotgun
1.plot: When the Cheng Detective Agency is hired by the CIA to investigate the murder of a US sailor, Sam is asked to help out as a favour to the widowed owner, Patricia. But as Sam tries to save the life of an innocent man, he is also forced to re-visit memories of the killing of a childhood friend, wrongly accused of stealing food while both boys were prisoners in Changi Prison during WW2.

2.title: Reach Out
2.plot: When Feng, arrives from China looking for the husband she hasn't seen since the war, no-one but she is even certain that he is still alive. But Sam knows what it's like to lose family and Patricia knows what it's like to lose a husband: both will move heaven and earth to solve the mystery of what happened to Feng's husband - but the case becomes even more immediate and mysterious when Feng is poisoned.

3.title: Ball of Confusion
3.plot: While delivering some photographs to a former Agency client Patricia is caught up in one of riots sweeping through the streets of Singapore. She is hurt. But this was no accident - she was deliberately attacked and the photographs stolen. Hafiz, a Malay photo journalist takes her to safety. When Hafiz is accused of being involved in the riots Patricia and Sam work to prove his innocence. The trail leads them to a secret MI6/Special Branch operation against subversives.

4.title: Give Me Money
4.plot: While trying to sort out Kang's gambling debts to Kay Song (the Red Dragons heir) Sam is reluctantly drawn into the detective agency's investigation into whether Claire Simpson's husband Frank has been taking kickbacks from clients. If the allegation is proved Frank's boss, Maxwell Black, will kick Frank out of the company (and Singapore), separating and Sam and Claire forever.

5.title: Heatwave
5.plot: When Claire finds the medicines Maxwell Black's company is providing to children in a small village hospital aren't working, she insists that the company investigate the problem. Sam proves that the genuine drugs are being diluted and that once the medicines are shown to be ineffective the worried families turn to expensive black market substitutes. It is all part of an elaborate scam run by the Secret Society. Finding the answer is one thing. Claire discovers that her quest creates problems that affect Sam, Frank and others.

6.title: Tracks of My Tears
6.plot: When a newborn baby is left on the doorstep of the Cheng Detective Agency, Patricia and Sam have to figure out what they're meant to do with him. Su ling confronts her fear and desire over a relationship with Conrad. Patricia receives a package containing Winston's fob watch which was believed stolen when he was murdered. And Kang does a deal with the Devil.

7.title: My Girl
7.plot: Caught transporting explosives, Kang is facing the gallows if Sam cannot track down and get the truth from a leading trade unionist, Lim Chee Kit, whose organisation is suspected of being involved in a recent bombing. The case is further complicated because Chee Kit's brother is James Lim, a well-connected businessman with political aspirations. Although estranged from his brother and disagreeing with Chee Kit's politics, James Lim has hired Sam and the Agency to find and help his estranged brother before the police arrest him.

8.title: Episode #1.8
8.plot: When two young Australian women vanish from a freighter near Singapore, the Australian embassy asks Sam to discover what happened to them. Meanwhile, Patricia copes with devastating revelations about her late husband.

9.title: Episode #1.9
9.plot: Sam's old friend Robert Collier is arrested for murdering his date, bartender and aspiring reporter Angelica Warnock. Convinced of his innocence, Sam tries to clear his name-but even Robert himself can't remember what happened that night.

10.title: Episode #1.10
10.plot: With new leads to follow, the team focuses on investigating Winston's murder. The evidence trail leads to Winston's elusive last client, a hired assassin, and treachery among Singapore's power players. Finally, Sam and Claire come to a decision about their relationship.

imdb.plot outline: It's 1964. The world is changing, the global balance of power is shifting and Singapore is at a crossroads. The colonial rule of the British has finally come to an end and independence is on the horizon. It's an exciting time where the island state can finally forge its own identity. The heartbeat of the nation stems from one main artery that runs through the island. Whether it is culture or crime, politics or patriotism, espionage or enterprise, all paths lead to Serangoon Road. This is the world of Sam Callaghan, Kang, Patricia Cheng and the clients of the Cheng Detective Agency. Sam Callaghan agrees to help Patricia Cheng after her husband is killed while working on a case. Patricia may not be a detective, but she knows her company needs a good investigator with contacts in the various local communities as well as among the ex-pats. Sam is all of that. But, after a childhood in a POW camp and a checkered career in Military Intelligence during the Malay Emergency, he is also carrying a lot of baggage. The Cheng Detective Agency's cases range from the usual (straying spouses and petty fraudsters) to conspiracies and events with international implications. Sam's contacts from his military days are useful - but they drag him back into a dark world that he would prefer to leave behind.
imdb.title: Serangoon Road
plot: _Serangoon Road_ (qv) is a detective noir series set against the tumultuous backdrop of 1960s Singapore.::Anonymous

It's 1964. The world is changing, the global balance of power is shifting and Singapore is at a crossroads. The colonial rule of the British has finally come to an end and independence is on the horizon. It's an exciting time where the island state can finally forge its own identity. The heartbeat of the nation stems from one main artery that runs through the island. Whether it is culture or crime, politics or patriotism, espionage or enterprise, all paths lead to _Serangoon Road_ (qv). This is the world of Sam Callaghan, Kang, Patricia Cheng and the clients of the Cheng Detective Agency. Sam Callaghan agrees to help Patricia Cheng after her husband is killed while working on a case. Patricia may not be a detective, but she knows her company needs a good investigator with contacts in the various local communities as well as among the ex-pats. Sam is all of that. But, after a childhood in a POW camp and a checkered career in Military Intelligence during the Malay Emergency, he is also carrying a lot of baggage. The Cheng Detective Agency's cases range from the usual (straying spouses and petty fraudsters) to conspiracies and events with international implications. Sam's contacts from his military days are useful - but they drag him back into a dark world that he would prefer to leave behind.::HBO Asia

The political landscape of S.E. Asia was drastically changed in 1964 as MI-6, CIA and a host of rival gangs and factions tore apart Singapore, Indonesia, Vietnam, Laos etc. plunging them further into the war which officially started in 1955 but did not "heat up" until the mid to late '60s. Rebel, Sam Callahan, is Australian by birth; with his mother he was interned at Changi by the Japanese during WWII. Sam is deeply ingrained in all facets of Singapore society. His dead boss, detective Winston Cheng, leaves a widow, Patricia, who is intent on finding her husband's killer. With the help of Su Ling, Patricia's niece, Kang, Sam's Asian business partner, a journalist named Bruce "Macca" MacDonald and a ragtag string of sometimes associates, they run the Cheng Detective Agency and mix into and resolve cases of both international and global importance.::LA-Lawyer
